full_text:
Out-of-Sequence Transactions

Lesson
objectives

* Define an out-of-sequence (OOS) transaction

¢ Explain how PolicyCenter handles an OOS
transaction

* Define conflicting transactions

« Describe how a conflict between transactions
is resolved in PolicyCenter

How will the application respond if | start making
multiple changes to a policy? How will it know which
change takes precedence over another?

| Review: Policy transaction graphs fa

into effect or expires
Submission
Change 1

Renewal iD uo0

Guidewire documentation uses graphic convention to represent how transactions
change policies over time

* Horizontal axis represents the policy term (“real-time”)

« Vertical axis represents the policy as modeled in PolicyCenter (“model time”)

Out-of-sequence transactions i

Eff date 3/15 out-of-sequence

A transaction created after a bound transaction, but becomes effective before the
bound transaction is known as an “out-of-sequence” (OOS) transaction

| What can or cannot be out-of-sequence i

Simone

Agent

Sometimes multiple changes to a policy may
impact the same information on the policy. How
does PolicyCenter deal with a conflict like that?

| What is a conflict? G

Ls Sa ee ett reut |

Liability deductible set at $500 | Change to $1000 Change to $250 Conflict

Transaction does

2 Liability deductible set at $500 | Change to $1000 not change the limit No conflict

3 Vehicle 1 created Vehicle 2 created Vehicle 3 created No conflict

Aconflict occurs when both transactions modify the same field, but each transaction
sets the field to a different value
* Creating new objects (e.g., coverables, coverages) usually does not cause a conflict

* If one transaction changes a field, and the other transaction does not change the field, it is not
a conflict

| PolicyCenter merges data when no conflicts are fa
present

Out-of-sequence transactions and

click here

Note: The demonstration opens a new tab in your browser. When the demonstration ends, the
original course launch window appears. Return to this window to continue this presentation.

Question

,~ — What makes a transaction out-of-sequence?

4
¢
¢

Sooo oooe sooo oOo oOo oAaDS

Answer

ae What makes a transaction out-of-sequence?

¢
¢

A transaction is out-of-sequence if it is entered after some other bound transaction but
has an effective date earlier than the effective date of the first bound transaction.

Sooo ooo ooo Oooo oOoD

Question

,7~ — Cana submission be out-of-sequence? Why or why not?

4
¢
¢

Sooo oooe sooo oOo oOo oAaDS

Answer a

ae Can a submission be out-of-sequence? Why or why not?

¢
¢

No, a submission can never be out-of-sequence. A submission creates a policy and
therefore must be the first transaction that can be issued against a policy. You cannot
have transactions effective earlier than the policy's creation date.

Sooo ooo ooo Oooo oOoD

Question G

Can a change be out-of-sequence? When you start an out-of-sequence

,’ transaction, how do you know that it is an out-of-sequence transaction?

¢
¢

Sooo oooe sooo oOo oOo oAaDS

Answer a

Can a change be out-of-sequence? When you start an out-of-sequence

,’ _ transaction, how do you know that it is an out-of-sequence transaction?

¢
¢

Yes, a change can be out-of-sequence. PolicyCenter displays an "out-of-sequence"
dialog box before starting the wizard and displays a warning label at the top of the
wizard screens.

Sooo ooo ooo Oooo oOoD

Question

_ _ What criteria does PolicyCenter use to determine if an out-of-sequence
,’ __ transaction conflicts with a "later effective" transaction?

¢
¢

Sooo oooe sooo oOo oOo oAaDS

Gi

Answer

What criteria does PolicyCenter use to determine if an out-of-sequence
,’ _ transaction conflicts with a "later effective" transaction?

¢
¢

If each transaction changes a single given field to a different value, then the two
transactions are in conflict.

Sooo ooo ooo Oooo oOoD

Gi

Question G

_~ — 'fthere are no conflicts, what additional work must the end user do?

4
¢
¢

Sooo oooe sooo oOo oOo oAaDS

Answer a

_~ — 'fthere are no conflicts, what additional work must the end user do?

¢
¢
¢

When there are no conflicts, there is no additional work. PolicyCenter automatically
merges the data from the two transactions.

Sooo ooo ooo Oooo oOoD

Question

_ _ If there is at least one conflict, what additional work must the end user
ra do?
7

Sooo oooe sooo oOo oOo oAaDS

Gi

Answer a

__ If there is at least one conflict, what additional work must the end user
“ do?
74

For each conflict, the end user must identify whether or not the earlier effective-dated
value overrides the future effective-dated value in the future slice of the policy.

Sooo ooo ooo Oooo oOoD

Lesson
objectives * Define an out-of-sequence (OOS) transaction

review ¢ Explain how PolicyCenter handles an OOS
transaction
* Define conflicting transactions
« Describe how a conflict between transactions
is resolved in PolicyCenter

| Student exercise
